reviews.review_msg: Best Prof!!! He is also very approachable. I enjoyed his Epistemology course and loved Ethics of War! He does a GREAT job simplifying complex ideas and also really engages the class to understand the material. None of the material is easy but at the end of the course you'll be amazed how well you understand it!  BONUS: no textbook, just handouts

Has the unique ability to let a class struggle with a difficult issue while keeping it firmly on track. Always on-topic and insightful discussions. Readings are challenging, but hey, it's philosophy. He does a great job of highlighting what he thinks is important without going over every detail. Creates a safe environment to try out ideas.

I was very surprised to find out that Martin is the department chair. I have no doubt that he is a very smart man, but his teaching skills are pretty terrible. Its as if he is lecturing to himself. He most often reads from the book and then lectures at the speed of an auctioneer leaving me and those around me very lost. Non phil majors, avoid!

This course was krap.  20% of the marks came from reading quizzes that test in-depth what we read for that week.  That meant 90% of the work was done by me scrambling, trying to figure out what some hot-shot thought of free will, and then I got to go to class and listen to Tiffany carry on about some lame, two-cent bit of information.
He tries to hard to get us to understand the vague things he says.

I'm a 3rd yr phil. student and I think hes the smartest person I've ever met. You can just see the gears turning. And he's wants students to succeed. That said, I find his personality to be very cold, he's quite inaproachable and its difficult to be friendly with him, personally he makes me quite nervous, as such I only went to his office hrs once.
Very intelligent, not as intimidating/self-important as a lot of the department's profs... good guy, very helpful during office hours; always wears baggy jeans & baseball cap - might be a raver.

He's a ponce.  Scaling has no place when essays are marked: he gives no explanation of how he marks, what he wants, doesn't even have any idea what anyone is getting.  Plays favourites in class, makes no sense unless you're a fundamentalist.  This class is not for the serious skeptic.

I really like the fact that Peter is organized and that he cares enough about helping students improve that he marks essays with an extra page that includes detailed and precise comments about where you went wrong.  That said, his tests are HARD.  He's one of the best in the SFU philosophy department though.

Peter is an extremely organized prof, which helps when the material is really tough (which it is).  I haven't had his exams/tests yet, but from what I hear they're hard.  I'll post more later once I actually take a test with him.
This was an extremely interesting class with thought provoking, but tricky, papers.
Why does she never show up to her own lectures? She cancelled 5/13 lectures with little notice. SFU should be ashamed to have such poor professors.

Lydia has completely disrespected the time, money, and effort that students have dedicated to their studies. She cancelled three lectures before week seven. In terms of the timing of her cancellations, she would wait until extremely late the night before (12:30 - 2:00 am) or only an hour before the lecture was scheduled. Not impressed.

Awesome class, cool assignments; an all-round first class prof! Highly recommend Lydia's classes, she keeps them entertaining and grounded to the realities of research /philosophy/academia in general. Her courses are fantastic for ensuring all students fully grasp the material and leave better prepared to comprehend heavy texts.

This rating is for PHIL 343 but it was not an option. Lydia is a pretty good professor. Lectures can occasionally feel a bit dry, but she gives clear instructions for her assignments/papers/final and definitely cares about students' success. She's also super accommodating, which is refreshing.

If you want to see how such a witty and brilliant professor as Lydia can teach so boring a class, enroll.  Lectures are unorganized and lack direction, but you can really tell that she is meticulous when you realize one hour into the class all she has talked about was something minuscule. I learned nothing from this class.
